      Constructs a new LanguageManager object.
      Parameter:
      plugin - The JavaPlugin instance
      langFolder - The folder where language files are stored
      resourceDirectory - The resource directory of the plugin
      prefix - The prefix for the language files

      public void addVariableForEngine(ExpressionEngine engine, String key, Object value)

      Adds a variable to the specified ExpressionEngine.

      
 languageManager.addVariableForEngine(engine, "key", value);
      Parameter:
      engine - the expression engine to add the variable to
      key - the variable name
      value - the variable value

    • addVariableGlobally

      public void addVariableGlobally(String key, Object value)

      Adds a variable with the given key and value to all registered ExpressionEngine instances.

      
 languageManager.addVariableGlobally("key", value);
      Parameter:
      key - the variable name
      value - the variable value

    • removeVariableGlobally

      public void removeVariableGlobally(String key)

      Removes a variable with the given key from all registered ExpressionEngine instances.

      
 languageManager.removeVariableGlobally("key");
      Parameter:
      key - the variable name to remove

    • setCurrentLang

      public void setCurrentLang(LanguageFile currentLang, boolean log) throws NullPointerException
      Sets the current language to the specified language file.
      Parameter:
      currentLang - The language file to set as the current language.
      log - Whether or not to log the change.
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - If the language file is not found.

    • addLanguagesToList

      public void addLanguagesToList(boolean log)
      Adds languages to the list.
      Parameter:
      log - Whether to log the language registration or not.

    • updateLangFiles

      public void updateLangFiles()
      LanguageManager.updateLangFiles() updates the registered language files. It looks for the language file in the resource directory and if it is not found, it looks for the language file specified in the Plugin.languageForUpdates configuration option. If that is not found, it looks for the en.yml file. If any of these files are found, it uses ConfigUpdater to update the language file.

    • reloadLanguages

      public void reloadLanguages(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender messageReceiver, Boolean log)
      Reloads all languages and updates the language files.
      Parameter:
      messageReceiver - The command sender to send the message to.
      log - Whether to log the action or not.

      langName - The name of the language to be added.

    • getLang

      public LanguageFile getLang(String langName, boolean throwException) throws NullPointerException
      Gets the LanguageFile object associated with the given language name.
      Parameter:
      langName - The name of the language to get the LanguageFile object for.
      throwException - Whether or not to throw an exception if the language is not found.
      Gibt zurück:
      The LanguageFile object associated with the given language name, or null if the language is not found and throwException is false.
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - If the language is not found and throwException is true.

      public void removeLang(String langName)

      langName - The name of the language to be removed.

    • addPlaceholder

      public void addPlaceholder(PlaceholderType type, String key, Object value, boolean resetBefore)
      Adds a placeholder to the LanguageManager.
      Parameter:
      type - The type of placeholder.
      key - The key associated with the placeholder.
      value - The value to replace the placeholder with.
      resetBefore - Whether to reset all placeholders of the specified type before adding the new one.

    • addPlaceholders

      public void addPlaceholders(Map<String,Placeholder> placeholders, boolean resetBefore)
      Adds the given placeholders to the LanguageManager. If resetBefore is true, all existing placeholders will be reset before adding the new ones.
      Parameter:
      placeholders - The placeholders to add
      resetBefore - Whether to reset existing placeholders before adding the new ones

    • removePlaceholder

      public void removePlaceholder(PlaceholderType type, String key)
      Removes a placeholder from the LanguageManager. The placeholder must match the specified type and key in order to be removed.
      Parameter:
      type - The type of placeholder to remove.
      key - The key of the placeholder to remove.

    • removePlaceholders

      public void removePlaceholders(PlaceholderType type, List<String> keys)
      Removes the specified placeholders of the given type from the LanguageManager.
      Parameter:
      type - The type of placeholder to remove
      keys - The keys of the placeholders to remove

    • resetPlaceholders

      public void resetPlaceholders(PlaceholderType type, @Nullable @Nullable List<String> excludeKeys)
      Removes all placeholders of the specified type, excluding the keys specified in the excludeKeys list. If the excludeKeys list is null, all placeholders of the specified type will be removed.
      Parameter:
      type - The type of placeholders to reset.
      excludeKeys - A list of keys to exclude from removal, or null to remove all placeholders of the specified type.

    • resetSpecificPlaceholders

      public void resetSpecificPlaceholders(PlaceholderType type, @Nullable @Nullable List<String> includeKeys)
      Resets specific placeholders of a given type. If includeKeys is provided, only those keys will be reset. It iterates through the placeholders and checks if the type matches the given type or is of type ALL. If it does, the key is added to the list of keys to remove. Finally, the method calls removePlaceholders to remove the placeholders.
      Parameter:
      type - The type of placeholders to reset.
      includeKeys - A list of keys to include in removal or null to reset all placeholders of the specified type.

    • getPlaceholders

      public Map<String,Placeholder> getPlaceholders()
      Retrieves a map of all the placeholders in the LanguageManager.
      Gibt zurück:
      A map of all the placeholders in the LanguageManager.

    • replacePlaceholders

      public String replacePlaceholders(String message, Map<String,Placeholder> placeholders)
      Replaces placeholders in the given message with their corresponding values.
      Parameter:
      message - The message to replace placeholders in.
      placeholders - A map of placeholder names to their corresponding Placeholder objects.
      Gibt zurück:
      The message with all placeholders replaced.

    • getLangOrPlayerLang

      public LanguageFile getLangOrPlayerLang(boolean currentLang, String langName, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      This method retrieves a LanguageFile object from the LanguageManager. If the currentLang parameter is true, the current language is returned. If the langName parameter is not null, the language specified by the langName parameter is returned. If the player parameter is not null, the language associated with the player is returned. If the langName parameter is null and the currentLang parameter is false, the current language is returned.
      Parameter:
      currentLang - Whether to return the current language.
      langName - The name of the language to return.
      player - The player to return the language for.
      Gibt zurück:
      The LanguageFile object.

    • getObjectFromLanguageCacheOrConfig

      public <T> T getObjectFromLanguageCacheOrConfig(String path, String langName, Class<T> clazz)

    • getMessage

      public String getMessage(String path, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, boolean resetAfter)
      Gets a message from the specified path in the language file for the specified player.
      Parameter:
      path - The path of the message in the language file.
      player - The player to get the message for.
      resetAfter - Whether or not to reset the message after it is retrieved.
      Gibt zurück:
      The message from the specified path in the language file.

    • getMessage

      Parameter:

      player - The player to format the message for.
      langName - The name of the language file to get the message from.
      resetAfter - Whether to reset the placeholders after the message is retrieved.
      Gibt zurück:

    • getItem

      public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getItem(String path, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String langName, boolean resetAfter, MaterialCondition condition)
      Retrieves an ItemStack based on the provided path, player, language, and reset flag.
      Parameter:
      path - The path to the item configuration.
      player - The player for whom the item is intended.
      langName - The name of the language.
      resetAfter - A boolean flag indicating whether to reset placeholders after use.
      Gibt zurück:
      An ItemStack based on the specified parameters.

    • getMaterial

      public org.bukkit.Material getMaterial(String materialString, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String langName)
      Gets a Material from the specified material string.
      Parameter:
      materialString - The material string to get the Material from.
      player - The player to use for placeholder replacements.
      langName - The language name to use for placeholder replacements.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Material from the specified material string, or BARRIER if the material is invalid.

    • getMenuTitle

      public String getMenuTitle(String path, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)
      Gets the menu title for the given path in the language specified by the given language name.
      Parameter:
      path - The path of the menu title to get.
      player - The player to get the language name from.
      Gibt zurück:
      The menu title for the given path in the language specified by the given language name.

    • getMenuTitle

      public String getMenuTitle(String path, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String langName)
      Retrieves a menu title from the language file based on the provided path. The language file can be either the specified language or the player's language. The title is then formatted with the player's language and the prefix, and placeholders are replaced in the title.
      Parameter:
      path - The path to the menu title in the language configuration.
      player - The player for whom the menu title is intended.
      langName - The name of the language to use.
      Gibt zurück:
      The formatted menu title for the player.

    • getCustomObject

      public <T> T getCustomObject(String path, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player player, T defaultValue, boolean resetAfter)
      Retrieve a custom object from the specified path.
      Typparameter:
      T - The type of the custom object.
      Parameter:
      path - The path to the custom object.
      player - The player to retrieve the custom object for, or null for global.
      defaultValue - The default value to return if the custom object is not found.
      resetAfter - Whether to reset the custom object after retrieval.
      Gibt zurück:
      The custom object, or the default value if not found.

    • getCustomObject

      public <T> T getCustomObject(String path, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String langName, T defaultValue, boolean resetAfter)
      Gets a custom object from the language file.
      Typparameter:
      T - The type of the object.
      Parameter:
      path - The path to the object in the language file.
      player - The player to use for placeholders.
      langName - The language name to use.
      defaultValue - The default value to return if the object is not found.
      resetAfter - Whether to reset the placeholders after getting the object.
      Gibt zurück:
      The object from the language file, or the default value if not found.

      public ExpressionEnginePool getExpressionEnginePool()

    • unregisterGlobalFunction

      public void unregisterGlobalFunction(String functionName)

    • getExpressionEngineFor

      public ExpressionEngine getExpressionEngineFor(org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String languageName)
      Retrieves the ExpressionEngine for a specific player and language. If the player is null, it retrieves the engine for the specified language. If the languageName is null, it retrieves the default language engine.
      Parameter:
      player - The player to get the ExpressionEngine for (nullable).
      languageName - The name of the language to get the ExpressionEngine for (nullable).
      Gibt zurück:
      The ExpressionEngine for the specified player and language, or null if not available.

    • parseEmbeddedExpressions

      public String parseEmbeddedExpressions(String input, org.bukkit.entity.Player player, String languageName)
      Parses all embedded EXPRESSION(expr) or EXPR(expr) segments in the input string, evaluates them, and replaces them with their results. If parsing fails, leaves the original text and stops further parsing.
      Parameter:
      input - The input string possibly containing embedded expressions.
      player - The player context for per-player language (nullable).
      languageName - The language context (nullable, uses default if null).
      Gibt zurück:
      The string with all embedded expressions evaluated and replaced.
